activities.loc: Grant County Courthouse - Br. II - 2nd Floor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laura Lee Harman

defendant.name: Harman, Laura Lee

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice- Court Appointed Atty Fees

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laura Lee Harman in court.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Laura Lee Harman.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. State calls Deputy Eric Ellis, sworn and testifies. State moves for admission of e-filed Ex #1 - Officer's Report, received by court.  Attorney Kieler objects to  bind over. Court binds the matter over and State will be filing Information with same charge. Defendant enters plea of NG. Status: 11/7/22 at 11:30 am. No Trial weeks given. Will be discussed at Status if needed. Court reminded Defendant to pay attorney fees.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Laura Lee Harman in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Defendant heard on trying to retain an attorney. Court finds that defendant does qualify for court appointed attorney. Court appoints Attorney Ryan Kieler. Defendant to repay county at at rate of $100 a month. First payment is due September 9, 2022. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on August 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Laura Lee Harman in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Court reviews court appointed attorney paperwork. Defendant should try to retain an attorney before court will appoint one. State requests a signature bond. Court heard and orders $500 signature bond. Status date set.
